title: Point 1
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Declares class header: class LapTracker

Canonical Solution: 

public class LapTracker
{
   private int numLaps;
   private int numCalls;
   private int resetFrequency;

   public LapTracker(int resetFreq)
   {
      numLaps = 0;
      numCalls = 0;
      resetFrequency = resetFreq;
   }

   public int addLaps(int additionalLaps)
   {
      if (numCalls == resetFrequency)
      {
         numCalls = 0;
         numLaps = 0;
      }
      numCalls++;
      numLaps += additionalLaps;
      return numLaps;
   }
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • declare the class as private
  • include extraneous code outside the class
  • include () with or without parameters in the class header

The response earns the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • declare the class as private
  • include extraneous code outside the class
  • include () with or without parameters in the class header

title: Point 2
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Declares private instance variables that can be used to determine the lap count, the reset frequency, and the number of times the method is called

Canonical Solution: 

public class LapTracker
{
   private int numLaps;
   private int numCalls;
   private int resetFrequency;

   public LapTracker(int resetFreq)
   {
      numLaps = 0;
      numCalls = 0;
      resetFrequency = resetFreq;
   }

   public int addLaps(int additionalLaps)
   {
      if (numCalls == resetFrequency)
      {
         numCalls = 0;
         numLaps = 0;
      }
      numCalls++;
      numLaps += additionalLaps;
      return numLaps;
   }
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • incorrectly initialize the instance variables

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • declare any instance variables static
  • omit private in instance variable declaration
  • declare a variable outside the class
  • declare an instance variable inside the constructor
  • declare any of the three with a non-numeric type

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • incorrectly initialize the instance variables

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • declare any instance variables static
  • omit private in instance variable declaration
  • declare a variable outside the class
  • declare an instance variable inside the constructor
  • declare any of the three with a non-numeric type

title: Point 4
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Constructor assigns correct initial value to reset frequency instance variable

Canonical Solution

public class LapTracker
{
   private int numLaps;
   private int numCalls;
   private int resetFrequency;

   public LapTracker(int resetFreq)
   {
      numLaps = 0;
      numCalls = 0;
      resetFrequency = resetFreq;
   }

   public int addLaps(int additionalLaps)
   {
      if (numCalls == resetFrequency)
      {
         numCalls = 0;
         numLaps = 0;
      }
      numCalls++;
      numLaps += additionalLaps;
      return numLaps;
   }
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • assign values to instance variables from an unknown source
  • assign initial values to local variables instead of instance variables, even if the local variables are declared as private
  • assign parameter to a variable with incompatible data type

title: Point 6
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Maintains correct lap count with reset to 0 when appropriate (algorithm)

Canonical Solution

public class LapTracker
{
   private int numLaps;
   private int numCalls;
   private int resetFrequency;

   public LapTracker(int resetFreq)
   {
      numLaps = 0;
      numCalls = 0;
      resetFrequency = resetFreq;
   }

   public int addLaps(int additionalLaps)
   {
      if (numCalls == resetFrequency)
      {
         numCalls = 0;
         numLaps = 0;
      }
      numCalls++;
      numLaps += additionalLaps;
      return numLaps;
   }
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • fail to return the count
  • use a variable declared outside the method as an instance variable when instance variables do not exist

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to declare or properly update all needed instance variables
  • calculate the correct count but return something else

title: Point 7
stimulusHtml:

Canonical Solution: 

public class LapTracker
{

      numCalls = 0;

   public int addLaps(int additionalLaps)
   {
      if (numCalls == resetFrequency)

         numCalls = 0;
         numLaps = 0;
      }
      numCalls++;
      numLaps += additionalLaps;
      return numLaps;

}
